line.words: One day while on a long walk Hilda sat down to eat her lunch on a soft, blue rock. Just as she was peeling the lid off her yoghurt the soft, blue rock suddenly moved and she spilt the yoghurt all over her knees.

line.words: “Oh” said the giant, “I have walked here from over that way,” he pointed towards the other side of the planet, “because my home is frozen and slow and we never see the sun.”

subtitle.line: —¡Ooh! —dijo el gigante—, yo he caminado hasta aquí desde ese lugar—. Él señaló hacía el otro lado del planeta. –Porque mi casa es muy fría y todo es muy lento y nunca vemos el Sol.

line.words: “Oh wow!” said Hilda, ”we can see the sun and the moon and…” she looked back to the giant, “what are all those other planets?”

subtitle.line: —¡Ooh wow! —dijo Hilda—, podemos ver el Sol y la Luna y…, —Volteó a ver al gigante—, ¿Qué son todos esos otros planetas?

line.words: “We can see them all from here, Hilda; Mercury, Venus, Pluto, over there are Jupiter and Uranus, and right down there are Neptune and planet Earth.”

subtitle.line: —Podemos verlos todos desde aquí, Hilda: Mercurio, Venus, Plutón; por allá están Júpiter y Urano, y justo aquí abajo está Neptuno y el planeta Tierra.

line.words: Hilda offered to share her apple with the giant and the two of them decided there and then to make a cosy home together in this beautiful spot.

line.words: That night they fell asleep counting all the planets and stars they could see in the night sky.
